sentences.sContent: If you enjoy the thrill of bungee jumping, you probably found 2010 an exhilarating sales year.
sentences.sContent_eng: If you enjoy the thrill of bungee jumping, you probably found 2010 an exhilarating sales year.
sentences.sCn: 如果你喜欢蹦极跳的刺激，你可能会发现2010是一个令人振奋销售年度。

sentences.sContent: And so Eagleman came up with an original experimental paradigm: SCAD jumping, which is often described as bungee jumping without the bungee.
sentences.sContent_eng: And so Eagleman came up with an original experimental paradigm: SCAD jumping, which is often described as bungee jumping without the bungee.
sentences.sCn: 所以，毅革曼想出了一个原创的实验范式：SCAD跳，它通常被描述为没有蹦极的蹦极跳。

sentences.sContent: B: Well, we went bungee jumping when we were in Australia.
sentences.sContent_eng: B: Well, we went bungee jumping when we were in Australia.
sentences.sCn: 哦，在澳大利亚的时候我们去玩了蹦极跳。

trans.tranOther: a sport in which you jump off something very high with a long length of special rope that stretches tied to your legs, so that you go up again without touching the ground
